page.title: 07WONERSH
page.content: Many picturesque cottages and period residences may still be seen in the village of Wonersh,some of which date from the time when it was a thriving clothing centre.The parish church was partly destroyed by fire in 1793,but was restored and retains numerous interesting features.The oldest parts of the church are the Saxon nave wall and the Norman tower base.Also to be noticed are the 15th century brasses. The main street in Wonersh,The Street, is dotted with many architectural masterpieces,including the 14th century coaching inn,the Grantley Arms.Wonersh also houses several medieval private residences. Great Tangley Manor surrounded by a moat,is a splendid half-timbered and gabled Elizabethan residence.
